title: Adding Conditions
intro: FieldLogs embeds a decision engine aimed at providing smarter templates. It dramatically reduces the number of steps/actions a user has to scan in order to find what is relevant. Conditions are a great way to collect data only when required.

blocks.content: Conditions are defined as simple Scripts execution.

It is required for a Condition that the Last Instruction is an 'Expression Evaluation' Instruction, and that this expression's result is a Boolean. If this expression returns 'true' the Step will be displayed, if not, it will remain hidden to the user.
Only a subset of the Scripting instructions are available for condition definition. More information in the 'Scripting Section'.
If a specific Step should be displayed only if in certain condition, just select this Step and open the Condition Editor. See the image below for more detail:
To modify the Condition on which a specifc Step is displayed, just select this Step and open the Condition Editor. See the image below for more detail:
Most of the simple conditions will have a format like, 'If the User gave a specific answer to a preceeding Step. This can be achieved easily with a simple Script:

points.text: 1st Instruction will retrieve the answer given by the user to the preceeding Step, and keep it in a Local Variable. See the 'Get Step Value' Instruction type
2nd Instruction will be an 'Expression Evaluation' evaluating if the given answer matches the condition.
